casebody.data:
CARL J. EHBETS, Respondent, v. JOHN W. BIGELOW, Appellant.

Before Curtis, Ch. J., Sedgwick and Freedman, JJ.

Decided June 18, 1880. Appeal by the defendant from a judgment for plaintiff entered upon a verdict for plaintiff for $347. The case involves only questions of fact. Sedgwick & Curtis, attorneys, and George S. Sedgwick, of counsel, for appellant. Martin & Smith, attorneys, and M. W. Divine, of counsel, for respondent. Curtis, Ch. J.,

wrote for affirmance, with costs; Sedgwick and Freedman, JJ., concurred.
